description:
The user guide currently has a section describing how to import
a bootable image into a volume, but it doesn't include instructions
on how to import an image into an encrypted volume and boot from it.

comments.content:
I've been looking for the best place in the nova docs to add instructions for booting from encrypted volumes, and it doesn't look like there are currently instructions for booting from volumes in general (this was at https://github.com/openstack/openstack-manuals/blob/a112d4df5a59ac752a043a43bc30303e65de35ad/doc/user-guide/source/cli-nova-launch-instance-from-volume.rst before the docs changes).

The only docs I've found referencing booting from a volume are in openstackclient, with the server-create command (see https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/cli/command-objects/server.html#server-create ).

There's a list of volume commands in the nova admin guide (see https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/manage-volumes.html ) but I don't see any boot commands related to volumes.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~brianna-poulos
